intro: Lithospermum patulum, commonly known as the narrowleaf lithosperm, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Lithospermum patulum is known for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal remedies.
